text: agent: This happens often with our customers so that's why our website and MyDMV are so useful for our customers. Just check if you can make your transaction online so you don't have to go to the DMV Office. user: Ok, and can you tell me again where should I report my new address? agent: Sure. Any change of address must be reported to the DMV, that's for the address associated with your license and any of your vehicles. user: Can you tell me more about Traffic points and their cost? agent: Traffic points is the system used by DMV to track dangerous drivers. The cost of the traffic points is independent of the DRA, so you get a separate charge based on the total points you accumulate.

agent: Yes. This is the system DM uses to keep a record of dangerous drivers. The cost of the DMV charge, that it's a separate charge from the DRA, depends on the total points you accumulate. user: It's always a hassle to bring all the required documents to the DMV Office. Please tell me an alternative. agent: This happens quite often with our customers when they don't bring some of the necessary documents or requirements to complete their transactions. The best you can do is to check our website to see if you can do your transaction online so you don't have to go to the DMV Office. user: In case I have a problem with my insurance and your inquiry letter does not resolve the problem, what would happen. agent: In that case, we must suspend the vehicle registration and if the problem continues, your driver's license. More than 300,000 registrations a year are suspended due to failing to maintain insurance.

agent: In that case, we must suspend the vehicle registration and if the problem persists, your driver's license. This happens quite often a year due to failing to maintain insurance. user: What could happen if I forget to update my new address with you guys? agent: If you move and don't update your address who won't know about any insurance problem and we'll have to suspend your registration and license. user: Can I leave the state without notifying DMV? agent: Thanks to the communications between states you can resolve any previous problem you have in New York State before registering in the new state.

agent: the charge you get from DMV is based on how many points you have accumulated. user: tell me about the documentation I should bring when going to a DMV office. agent: Since many of our customers tend to forget some document or requirement for their transactions, we recommend that you go first to our website to see if you can do your transaction online, that way you can avoid any hassle from going to the DMV Office. user: Would there be a problem if I leave the state without notifying DMV? agent: You should resolve any pending problem you have here before moving to another state, if you not, you could not get a new license in your new home state.

agent: Yes, before going to the DMV office you should check our website to see if you can do your transaction online. user: Can I just write my new address in the back of my license if I haven't updated my address at the DMV? agent: No, by statute, you must update your address at the DMV whenever you move from your registered address. It's not enough to just write the new address in the back of your license, or inform an officer when getting a ticket, or tell the United States Postal Service. user: How will you contact me about a problem with my insurance? agent: When we detect any problem with your insurance, we'll mail you an insurance inquiry letter to let you resolve the problem.

agent: first, is not enough to update your address with a third party, you should keep your address updated in the DMV, if not, you could miss a suspension order and may be charged with operating an unregistered vehicle. user: Tell me about the costs of traffic points. agent: the cost of the charge you can get from the DMV due to a traffic violation varies according your accumulated traffic points. user: What else could happen if I don't update my address with you guys?. agent: You won't learn about any insurance problem and we'll suspend your registration and license.

agent: The points is the system used for the DMV to keep track of dangerous drivers. The amount you pay from a DMV charge for a traffic ticket depends on the number of accumulated points. user: Isn't the DMV charge included in the DRA charge? agent: No, the DRA and DMV charge are separate charges. user: What if I have an insurance problem and the inquiry letter does not resolve it? agent: In that case, we have to suspend the vehicle registration and, if the problem persists, your license.

agent: Well, you need to know that States communicate with each other, so if you leave the state without notifying DMV will be aware of that. Before leaving the state, make sure to resolve any unaswered tickets, suspensions or revocations. 
You also have to surrender your license(s) plate(s) to NYS when you get to the new state.  user: Ok. I suppose I have to get a new car insurance in the new state. What happens if by accident I let the insurance lapse? agent: DMV will suspend your registration and license.  user: Let's say I get to a new state, I register my vehicle, get my car insurance and all that stuff but my coverage is dropped for any reason. What would DMV do in that case?  agent: We would send you an inquiry letter to allow you to clear up the problem. We send 500000 inquiry letters a year, so that's covered.

user: Insurance problems? Like what. Can you explain more? agent: New York State wants every motorist to maintain auto insurance , and we watch your insurance status electronically agent: Does your insurance coverage continue? user: Yes I think. I will check again. agent: Already, If coverage is dropped, we mail you about that. So your adress is so important.

agent: DMV maintains a point system to track dangerous drivers. Often motorists convicted of a traffic ticket feel they have resolved all their motoring issues with the local court , but later learn that the Driver Responsibility Assessment DRA is a separate DMV charge based on the total points they accumulate  user: What happens if I still have a problem afer getting the inquiry letter? agent: we must suspend the vehicle registration user: When do I need to report my address update? agent:  you must report a change of address to DMV within ten days of moving

user: What happens if my insurance runs out? agent: Because we all pay indirectly for crashes involving uninsured motorists, New York State requires every motorist to maintain auto insurance every single day a vehicle is registered. DMV works with insurance companies to electronically monitor your insurance coverage agent: Has your insurance lapsed? user: Yes agent: We mail you an insurance inquiry letter to allow you to clear up the problem

agent: Yes, anything up to an impounded vehicle or encounters with law enforcement officers. user: What happens if my insurance lapses? agent: Your license and registration will be suspended. user: Will that happen automatically, or will I get a chance to reinstate my coverage first? agent: You will be sent an inquiry letter first, then if it isn't resolved your registration will be suspended.

agent: First, you should update your browser to its newest version available. user: What info can you give me about those that search for my DMV records? agent: We can supply you with the name and business address of the Dial-In account holder and the time, date and search criteria they used for the records. user: Just to check the address of contact is correct please tell me if this is the right one: NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137 agent: Yes, that's correct.

agent: Some examples are invoices, retainer agreements, consent forms, and surveillance reports, among other types of records. You should maintain these records to comply with our terms of service. user: How much should I pay for the dial-in search account fees? agent: The first deposit have to be enough to pay for two months of searches. user: What is the contact address for problems related to my dial-in search account? agent: you can mail the DMV to NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137

agent: Yes, an account will be created for you and we'll send you your account number and password. Your account number will never change. user: is there a fee for using the dial-in search account? agent: Yes, there's a fee that we must charge according to the NYS Vehicle and Traffic Law. This fee applies to private persons, commercial organizations and not-for-profit organizations. user: Do I need anything specific if I perform a search on behalf of a client? agent: You'll have to show permissible use of your client and your client-agent relationship.

agent: Due to the upgrading of our security protocols, you should make sure your browser is compatible. user: What kind of clients usually use the dial-in search account service? agent: The most common clients are attorneys, security personnel, insurance and private investigators and process servers. user: How can I verify if my browser is compatible? agent: You can visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ , there you will be informed if your browser is incompatible.

agent: To check for your browser compatibility yo should visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ user: Why would DMV ask me about my searches? agent: We need to verify the compliance of the dial-in Terms of Service. user: Would the dial-in search account service be useful for an attorney? agent: Yes, attorneys are among our most common clients.

agent: You can verify your browser compatibility by visiting https://encryption.ny.gov/ user: How should I pay for my dial-in account fees? agent: Customers must include a deposit with the application and the first deposit should be enough to pay for the first 2 months of searches. user: Can you repeat the address where I should send the form? agent: Yes, the address is Data Services - New Search AccountNYS Department of Motor Vehicles6 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228

agent: You can contact DMV at: NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137 dmvaccounts@gmail.com user: Thanks! But why can't I download the form? Does it have anything to do with the new security?  agent: Yes, we upgraded our security for better protection of the data. So, now you can't download any form as you usually did, to request a form you have to contact DMV. user: Can I visit the page with mi phone?  agent: Yes, most of smart phones have compatible browsers. Visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ to check that.

agent: If your application is complete, we will create an account and send you the number and password. The account is made up of a 7-digit number that will never change. user: I have forgotten my Dial-in Search Account data, what should I do? agent: To solve your problem with your Dial-in Search Account, you must contact us at: NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228. user: I understood that records of searches are private, is this true? agent: No, records of searches are public records.

agent: No, sorry, but at the moment DMV isn't accepting any payments with credit cards. user: Um, ok. Now back with browser issue, what about if i'm still having problems with your page after being updated? agent: In case that occurs, just update you browser to its newer version and try accessing once again. user: I'll do that, thanks. One more question, if i request some searches being delivered to me via mail-order, do i need to pay  for them in which way, please? agent: In that case, you can use you account balance to make the corresponding payment for those mail-order searches.

agent: Organizations that are exempted from the search fees are any public organizations and other private entities acting pursuant to section 722 of the New York State County Law that makes a search due to a public purpose. user: What do I need to do if the DMV inquire me about a search that i did not perform? agent: If something like that happens, you first need to check whether other users of your account did the search. If that is not the case, you need to contact the DMV immediately to inform about this. user: If I searched a motorist records, will the DMV tells the owner of the records? agent: Yes. This is because, the records of searches are public records and the DMW will inform the motorist if the motorist ask the DMV.

agent: There are few ways to contact us. You can always come to our physical location at NYS DMV DIAL - IN Accounts Room 2316 Empire State Plaza, Albany , NY 12228. You can also email us at [ email protected ] [ 5 ] . user: How do i pay for the searches that i have done? agent: We would subtract the fee from the balance in your account. user: Does security protocols update relates to browser compatibility? agent: Yes. In order to better protect your data, we need to update it. Updating the security protocols means that latest version of browser is needed to enable the updates to be executed.
agent: 12228 user: are there fees for using a dial-in search account? agent: there are some organizations that are exempt from search fees user: what is their phone number? agent: 473-2137

agent: Some organizations are exempt from search fees.  Any public organization , its officers , a volunteer fire company , a volunteer ambulance service , or a legal aid bureau or society or other private entity acting pursuant to section 722 of the New York State County Law , that makes a search for a public purpose, is exempt from the search fees. user: How do I know if it's a public organization? agent: For more information, please visit our Escrow Accounts page. user: How do I apply? agent: Go to Data Services - New Search Account  NYS Dept of Motor Vehicles.

agent: If you're going to use your motorcycle on any public road or highway you must have insurance coverage. Motorcycle registrations are only valid for one year and expire on April 30. user: What if I use my motorcycle only on the outskirts of the city? agent: Any public road counts so you have to get insurance coverage. user: With how many names can I register a vehicle? agent: There're only 1 or 2 names allowed on a registration registrant. Both, the primary registrant and the co-registrant must sign the vehicle registration and provide proof of identity and date of birth.

agent: Yes, your vehicle must have New York State auto liability insurance coverage. user: Do I need to have insurance coverage for a motorcycle? agent: Yes, if you are going to use your motorcycle on a public road or highway, you must have insurance coverage. user: What should I take into consideration for my liability insurance coverage? agent: Your liability insurance coverage must remain in effect for as long as your registration is valid, there are exceptions for motorcycles.

agent: There are some exceptions for motorcycles. user: Regarding the name on my vehicle registration application and the one on the Insurance Identification Card, do they need to be the same? agent: yes, the names must match in both documents. user: Can I submit copies or faxes of my Insurance identification card to the DMV? agent: yes, you can. But take into consideration that the card will be rejected if the DMV barcode reader can not scan the barcode.

agent: Yes. The DMV will not accept a card if our barcode reader can't read the barcode. user: Should I get insurance for a motorcycle? agent: Yes. If you plan to ride your motorcycle on any public road or highway, you must have insurance coverage. user: So can I use a copy or fax of my Insurance Identification Card to give it to the DMV? agent: We do accept copies and faxes of Insurance identification cards, just make sure that the barcode is perfectly legible or it will get rejected if the DMV barcode reader can't scan it.

agent: It lasts for 1 year. user: Do the names on my vehicle registration application and insurance identification card have to match? agent: Yes, the names must be the same in both documents. user: will the insurance company give insurance proof after getting the insurance? agent: yes, the insurance company will issue proof of insurance in two ways.

agent: You cannot drive your motorcycle on public highways without having insurance in place. If your name differs from your insurance to your registration, your insurance coverage may lapse and become invalid, which could result in the DMV suspending your driver license and registration  user: I will have a problem in providing my original Insurance Identification Card. Will the DMV be able to accept a copy or a fax? agent: Once the DMV barcode reader can read scan the barcode on your Insurance Identification Card, this will be acceptable user: What type of policy do I need to have in place before I can register a vehicle? agent: Auto insurance liability is a pre-requisite before you can register a vehicle in New York

agent: 1 or 2 names on a registration registrants. user: What kind of insurance do I need to register my vehicle? agent: New York law requires that you have auto liability insurance coverage with a minimun amount of liability coverage of $10,000 for property damage for a single accident. user: Can there be 2 different names in the vehicle registration? agent: There can only be 1 or 2 names on a registration registrants. Fill and sign the form Vehicle Registration/Title Application PDF  MV-82 and provide their proofs of identity and date of birth. Both names must appear on the Insurance ID Card.

agent: Your insurance company will issue a proof of insurance in two ways: 
1) They will either give you to original NY state Insurance Cards or provide you with acces to your digital electronic NY State Insurance.
2) They will send  an electronic notice of insurance coverage  to the DMV. user: Great! I accidentally lost my Insurance Identification Card but I have a copy, would DMV accept a copy or a fax of my IIC? agent: Yes, they accept faxes or copies. Don't worry about that. However, if the barcode is not readable DMV won't accept it.  user: Thanks! One more question, I was living in a different State a few months ago, so I have an Insurance coverage from another state, If I want to register my vehicle here in new york can that out-of-state insurance be accepted?  agent: No, those documents are not accepted. If you want to register a car in New York, it MUST have a New York State insurance coverage.

agent: As long as your registration is valid, your insurance will remain in effect. user: Does that work for motorcycles too?  agent: Motorcycles are the black sheep in the family:Your motorcycle must have insurance coverage any time it is operated on a public road or highway. Unlike most other motor vehicles, motorcycles are registered for one year rather than two. By any means your motorcycle should operate on public highways without liability coverage in effect.
 user: When do my motorcyle registration expire?  agent: On April 30.

agent: It is  $ 10,000 for a single accident. user: Can i just sent copies or fax my Insurance Identification Card? agent: Yes but please make sure the barcode on the document is clear because the DMV will not accept a card that the DMV barcode reader could not read. user: What if the name on my vehicle registration application and Insurance Identification Card does not match? agent: You could not proceed with the registration.

agent: yes user: does the name on my application form and my insurance ID card need to be the same? agent: yes
 user: Do I have to get my insurance from New York? Do you accept out-of-state insurance? agent: No, we do not accept out-of-state insurance. The insurance must be from New York

agent: It's $80 for 2 years for all passenger vehicle registrations and renewals. For Livery and for-hire vehicles, the tax is $400 for one year. user: My vehicle registration is from Manhattan, New York. Does the tax apply to my vehicle? agent: Yes, your location apply to the vehicle use tax for all passenger registrations and renewals. user: tell me about the sales tax, how can I determine the fee? agent: For this, you should add 3.25% to the fee listed on the cart and then change the result to the nearest 0.25$

agent: You can see the use taxes and supplemental fees for all original registrations and renewals on the chart. The sales tax depends on the purchase price and your locality. You can go to the Department of Taxation and Finance website to see the current sales tax rates per jurisdiction. user: Where can I know more about these taxes? agent: You can ask the city or county where you reside or have a business. user: What charts should I use to determine the fees for commercial vehicles? agent: You have to use the registration fee and the county use tax charts.

agent: In your case, you should get form UT-11 from a local DMV office or a DMV call center. user: I want to know more about these taxes. agent: You can ask the city or county where you currently reside or have your business. user: I want to know more about the registration fee chart. agent: The fees on this chart are for commercial vehicles that are less than 18000 lbs in weight. For diesel commercial vehicles that are 8501 pounds or more in weight, there is an additional fee.

agent: For your case, you have to complete form UT-11C user: What can I use the use tax chart for counties outside New York City? agent: This chart shows the use taxes and supplemental fees for all the original registrations and renewals. user: And what if I'm from New York City and exempt from the NYC vehicle use tax? agent: Go and get the form UT-11 from a local DMV or from a DMV Call center

agent: The chart have the same name, county use tax chart. user: Where can I know more about these taxes? agent: You can ask your city or county about these taxes. user: Help me determine the correct fee. agent: ok, you have to add 3.25% to the fee listed in the chart and then change the value you get to the nearest 0.25$.

agent: You must complete the form UT-11C if you are living outside New Yor City. user: I am from New York and I want to register my vehicle. Do I have to pay any taxes? If so, where should I go? agent: Yes, you must pay a vehicle use tax when they register a commercial vehicle, To pay your vehicle taxes, you must go to the nearest DMV office or your preferred one. user: I'm a little lost, I don't know anything about paying my vehicle taxes or where to go. agent: Don't worry,  ask in your city or county where you reside.

agent: The chart shows you a list of counties: find the one you are living in and see the amount of the use tax.
You also have one chart for the registration fee depending on how much your vehicle weights.                           user: I have some questions regarding those taxes, with whom should I talk?  agent: You can ask the city or county where you reside. They will help you.  user: Ok, because it seems that I am exempt from the vehicle use tax in my county. agent: If you are exempt from the vehicle use tax, please complete the form UT-11C.

agent: In that case, the form you must fill out is the UT-11C. user: I am going to register my vehicle and I don't know if I have to pay a vehicle use tax or where to pay. Can you help me? agent: You must pay a vehicle use tax when you register a commercial vehicle or renew a commercial vehicle registration if you are residents of New York City. The DMV is responsible for collecting all taxes in the city and its counties. user: How can I know the fee I must pay? agent: Add 3.25% to the fee listed in the chart and change the result to the nearest $0.25.

agent: For all passenger vehicle registrations and renewals, the fees are 80$ for 2 years of Vehicle use tax and 400$ for 1 year for livery and for-hire vehicles. user: tell me about the county use tax chart for counties outside of New York City agent: This chart shows the use taxes and supplemental fees for registrations and renewals. For the sales taxes, it depends on the purchase price and your locality. You can get more info about the sales tax rates by jurisdiction  at the Department of Taxation and Finance website user: What if I'm from New York City and exempt from the vehicle use tax? agent: for that case, get the form UT-11 from a local DMV office or a DMV call center.

agent: 
Yes, the amount of the sales tax depends on the purchase price and its location. user: What happens if I am in New York city. agent: 
obtain form UT-11 from a local DMV office [1] or a Call Center user: 
Is New York an exempt city? agent: Yes, New York Bronx, Kings (Brooklyn), Nueva York (Manhattan), Queens, Richmond (Staten Island).

agent: Original registration fees include vehicle plate is $25 and the fee for the title certificate of $50. The chart will determine additional fees. 5&6 user: Thank you.  Do I have to pay use tax? agent: For some counties outside of New York City, there is a use tax.  Refer to the chart. user: Ok thank you. agent: Hope this has been helpful.

agent: That depends. You can check the section "registrations refunds for surrendered plates" for more info about that  user: In case I need to surrender my plate temporarily, can I do it? agent: Yes, you can. There's more info about this in the section " special procedures to surrender plates for a season - temporary surrender of plates" user: How should I mail my plate so I can get the FS-6 T receipt? agent: You should send the plate via registered or certified mail and request a return receipt, that way you can be notified by the US Postal Service that we received the plate.

agent: Only if your trailer doesn't have a valid registration. user: Can I give my plates to another person? agent: No, unless that person is going to surrender your plates for you. user: What would be the date used as the surrendered plates date? agent: The date we use for the surrendered plate dates is the mail postmark date.

agent: Remove the plates and the stickers. user: My plates were destroyed. agent: What should I do about it? user: I can't surrender my plates. agent: Just report the destroyed plates and surrender the registration. Later the DMV will give you a new registration and plates.

agent: What can I do if I have to surrender stolen plates? user: yes, my plates were stolen. agent: You have to report the stolen plates and surrender the registration, then the DMV will give you new registration and plates. user: how should I mail my surrendered plates? agent: mail the plates by registered or certified mail and ask for a return receipt.

agent: Normally a trailer does not need liability insurance, and no, the DMV will not suspend your driver license if you fail to surrender the plates. user: I want to give my plates to a friend, is that possible? agent: Just if that friend will surrender the plates for you. user: What form should I fill to surrender my plates? agent: The Plate Surrender Application PD-7 for each set of plates you are surrendering, you must to bring the plates and the form PD-7 to a DMV office.

agent: DMV offices will charge you a $1 fee to process the surrender user: I think I'd rather do that online, so how can I get the FS-6 T receipt if I do the process by mail? agent: We will mail you your FS-6 T receipt user: Awesome! One last question, is it necessary to surrender trailer plates? agent: If the trailer has no valid registration, you MUST surrender the plate.

agent: Yes. Along with that, you nee to complete the Plate Surrender Application form PD-7 for each set of plates you present to surrender. When you complete that, you can proceed to mail both the application and the plates. user: Ok, ok, thanks, i'll do that. Now, i need some info about plates if they get lost, or if they are stolen from me or you know, get destroyed. agent: No problem. Have you lost your plates? Or this have been stolen from you or got destroyed? user: Yeah, well, they were stolen from my vehicle some day ago. agent: I see. In that case, you need report those plates along with your registration. The DMV can issue to you a new registration and plates if everything is in order.

agent: Yes, sure!
First, you need to remove the plate and the stickers on it. Then go to www.dmvplatebymail.com and download de PD-7 application, and after that mail us the application to: NYS DMV6 Empire State PlazaRoom B240Albany , NY 12228. 
When we got all that, and after your application has been accepted we'll mail you your FS-6 T receipt. user: Ok, one last question. You told me that's it's ok to have gotten my plate stolen for trailer, because the liability insurance is not a MUST, and as long as I have a valid registration I'll be fine. But what If I have a car, and the plate is lost, stolen, or destroyed? agent: In that case, you need to report the plate as "stolen, lost or destroyed" and immediately surrender the registration. DMV will issue you a new plate and registration.  user: What if I'm in an another state? Would it be a problem? Or can I do the whole process by mail as if I was here? agent: You have to go to that state's DMV agency and surrender them there, but you can still surrender them by mail. Just make sure, you are in that specific state when you are in the DMV website.

agent: Yes however, if the trailer does not have a valid registration, you need to surrender the plates regardless of whether the trailer required or not to have a liability insurance. user: After i remove the plates and stickers at the DMV Office to surrender my plates, what should i do? agent: You will need to check the plates. Plate attached with plate frames and fasteners will not be accepted. user: For lost, stolen or destroyed plates, can i get a new one using the old registration? agent: No. You need to surrender the registration and a new registration and plates will be issued after that by the DMV.

agent: Yes, see special procedures to surrender plates for a season temporary surrender of plates user: What happens if my plates are missing? agent: Have they been lost or stolen? user: Yes stolen agent: Then you need to report plates that are lost , stolen or destroyed and surrender the registration. In these cases the DMV can issue you a new registration and plates

agent: Yes as long as he will surrender the plates for you. user: He's probably too young to understand forms and stuff. Can I fill in some of the paperwork online? agent: Yes there is the Complete the PD-7 application that is available as a PDF online. user: Can I submit that online or do I have to print it up and give it to him to bring in? agent: Yes you can submit the form online.

agent: we use the mail postmark date as the date that you surrendered your plates user: is there an application i need to do? agent: you must complete the plate surrender application PDE user: do motorcycles have a liability? agent: the dmv can issue you a new registration and plates.

agent: for that case, you have to go to a DMV office with your updated paperwork from the DHS and we'll update our records to show your new status so you can renew your non-driver ID card. user: My father is 64 years old, can he get a reduced fee benefit when renewing his non-driver ID card? agent: Yes, he is eligible to get a reduced fee or even "No Fee" ID card. user: What would apply to him? he also receives SSI. agent: Well, for his case, he receives SSI and is over 62 years old, he can get the "No Fee" renewal. The fee for those under 62 is $6.50.

agent: in that case, you'll receive your ID with an "Under 21" message written on it. user: Are there any fees for renewing online? agent: You'll just have to pay the regular fee for renewing your non-driver ID card. user: so, for renewing online the fee is? agent: Just the normal fees paid for a non-driver ID card renewal.

agent: We'll send you your non-driver ID card with the "UNDER 21" message on or near your birth date. user: In case my non-driver ID is expired for over 2 years can I still renew it? agent: you have to apply for an original non-driver ID card. user: My Temporary Visitor status was recently extended, what should I do now? agent: Go to a DMV office with your updated paperwork from the DHS. We'll use your updated paperwork to update our records to show that your status has been extended so you can renew your non-driver ID card. Your new card will show the new temporary visitor expiration date.

agent: No, there is no exception to this. user: So what can I do with my over 2 years expired non-driver ID card? agent: You have to get a new original non-driver ID card. user: I need to renew but I'm planning on going on a trip soon. agent: We recommend you to renew before your trip so you can get an Enhanced or REAL ID, and avoid another visit to the office later.

agent: You can use an Application for Permit, Driver License or Non-Driver ID Card, form MV-44 or or you can come to a DMV office when you can. user: I'd rather go to an office to keep my Standard document type, what are the steps? agent: You must follow the steps that I will indicate and complete the renewal notice MV-2 we mailed you. user: My non-driver ID expired 3 years ago, is this a problem? agent: Don't worry, we can solve it. You must apply for an original non-driver ID card. You can see the steps you should take in "Get a non-driver ID card NDID".

agent: You must bring an original copy of proof of your eligibility to get a reduced fee. user: What is my fee if I receive Supplemental Security Income SSI and I am 60 years old? agent: If you are 60 years old,, your fee is $ 6.50. user: I am somewhat busy and prefer to renew my Standard by mail. There is a problem with that? agent: If you renew by mail, your new ID will show: "NOT FOR FEDERAL PURPOSES".

agent: Yes, if your circumstances dictate that you do receive Supplemental Security Income SSI and if you are aged 62 or younger, the fee you will be charged is $6.50. user: Mailing documents is my preferred choice of communication. Can I please confirm the address that I can mail my ID renewal to is NYS Department of Motor Vehicles207 Genesee Street , Suite 6Utica , NY 13501 - 2874?  agent: Yes, I can confirm that information is correct. user: If I am out of the country, how will the Department of Motor Vehicles contact me if they required additional information? agent: It is a requiredment of the Department of Motor Vehicles that if you are overseas you must renew your non-drivers ID card through the mail. You will be including your overseas address with this application for their records.

agent: Very well. In that case, you'll need to complete the renewal notice form MV-2 that we mailed to you in order to proceed. user: Ok, yeah, i received that form. And what about the possibility for an ID with reduced fee or none at all? agent: That will depend if you meet the requirements. agent: When you registered your plates, you paid $137.50, which was for two years. This amount included $62.50, which was the registration fee for two years, that is $31.25 per year. agent: You can apply for a refund of the 2-year registration fee only if the registration was truly never used and it is not more than 60 days from the date the registration was issued.  A processing fee of a dollar is subtracted from the refund amount.  To apply, you must surrender the vehicle plates and the unused registration sticker and stub at the DMV office and request a 2-year refund.  If you are eligible, the DMV will issue a receipt that displays two year refund.  user: What procedure to I have to follow to get this refund, though, if I have changed my name?  agent: You must still surrender the vehicle plates at a DMV office, but request a transfer receipt, not a refund receipt.  You will then send that to the address of the Request for Refund MV-215 form along with the completed and signed Request for Refund [1] MV-215 and proof of the name change such as a marriage certificate, divorce certificate, or other court papers.   At that point, the DMV will issue your refund in your new name if you are eligible.  user: Will the DMV issue a refund if the registrant died?  agent: The DMV will issue the refund to the name of the estate if the plates are surrendered at the DMV office and a transfer receipt is requested and the executor of the estate sends a completed and signed Request for Refund [1]MV-215, with "deceased" written on the form, a photocopy of the death certificate, and the transfer certificate to the address listedon the Request for Refund MV-215.

agent: DMV is entering commercial driver self - certification and medical certification data daily, however due to the volume of responses it could take a period of time for a driver record to be fully updated user: What happens if my CDL was downgraded because of your " not certified " medical status agent: You will need to visit a local DMV office to upgrade your license back to a CDL user: Do I need a medical examiners certificate? agent:  If you expect to operate in an excepted driving type EA or EI then a Medical Examiner s Certificate is not required. agent: Yes... bicycle violations, pedestrian violations and parking violations. user: What happens if I am in New York and receive more than 6 points in 18 months? agent: You must pay a Driver Responsibility Assessment fee. user: A few months ago I was in another country and was convicted of a traffic violation, will I have problems here for that? agent: No, unless the violation you committed was in Ontario or Quebec.

agent: Well, you won't get any points in case of any of the following: any bicycle violation, any pedestrian violation or any parking violation. user: Ok, got it. Uh, and what happens if i'm out of NYS? agent: If the violation occurs outside NYS, your driving record won't be affected by the violation, because it's outside NYS jurisdiction. Only exception is, if the violation happens to be in Ontario or Quebec. user: Ok, thanks. May i know how my points are summed up, please? agent: Well, in first place, you must have a conviction by traffic violation. After that, points are added to your driving license. Second, the number of points to be added are based on your violation's date, not conviction's. And lastly,If the violation occurred within the last eighteen months, you'll certainly have those points added to your license.

agent: Yes, sure is. It's a DMV feature, which allows you to take a DMV- approved Point and Insurance Reduction Program that will help to prevent you lose your license in case you have already 11 or more points on your driving record. user: Oh, that's very nice of DMV. Say, what if i have a violation in my record and i didn't do it, but someone else did? agent: If you believe that is the case, you can make use of the hearing resource. but be aware that the hearing is not for probation of guilt or not. user: Oh, i see. Um, i'm dragging a out-of-state violation conviction, that does affect my driving record in any way? agent: Not at all. If you have any out-of-state conviction, it won't have any effect on you driving record. But if you were convicted on Ontario or Quebec, indeed it counts for your driving record.

agent: You can use the hearing resource for case revision. But if you're looking for a non-guilty outcome, i'm afraid DMV hearing isn't for that. user: Is there any way i can put down my points account? agent: There is. You have the Point and Insurance Reduction Program course. It's a DMV-approved course that will help to prevent you from losing your license in the event you accrued 11 or more points in your record. user: Isn't that great, huh?.  Now please, if happens i'm out of the state and i'm convicted for any traffic violation, that will affect my record in NYS? agent: Don't you worry. Unless that violation occurred on Ontario or Quebec, any out-of-state conviction won't be adding any points to your driving record.

agent: The Point and Insurance Reduction Program is DMV approved, which ultimately helps prevent you from losing your license, should you have accrued 11 points or more on your license user: When are points not assigned in the NYS Driver Point System? agent: Instances where points are not assigned are associated with violations relating to bicycles, pedestrians or parking user: How are the total number of points on my license calculated? agent: A conviction of a traffic violation has to occur before points accrue on your license. Your points total is calculated based on when you received the violation, not the date of conviction. Points are calculated on any violations that occurred within the last 18 months and are added together to give a total

agent: You can get a completed form Report of Lost or Stolen Motor Vehicle Items MV-78B from a police agency and send form MV-78B with form IRP-6. user: Where could I surrender my items? I have another plate I'd like to surrender.  agent: You should sent it to International Registration BureauPO Box 2850 ESPAlbany  NY 12220 - 0850s
 user: That's really far from where I live, I can't afford going there. I want to send them by mail, can you give me some information about that? agent: You have to complete and sign this form Schedule A & C pdf

agent: send the apportioned plates and the cab card to the address you see below. user: Where should I send the surrendered items? agent: Send it to International Registration Bureau, PO Box 2850, Albany, NY 12220-0850. user: How can I get a refund of the IRP registration fees I paid to the state of New York? agent: You only qualify for a refund if you surrender the apportioned plates to the NY State IRB and any of these listed conditions occurred:

- The NY State IRB made an error and the error is on your invoice.
- You paid duplicate apportioned registration fees for the same vehicle or vehicles.

user: Ok, thank you. Another question, i've paid fees in other jurisdictions, It is possible to get a refund for those IRP fees? agent: Yes, it is possible. With that intention, you must meet the following: the other jurisdiction made a mistake and that mistake is in your invoice and you paid the registration fees twice for just one vehicle. If you meet those, then a refund request is indeed possible. agent: None of your plates are lost or have been stolen, don't they? user: In fact, yes. Some pair of plates of mine are lost right now. agent: Very well. Then you should go to a police agency and get a MV-78B form for Report of Lots or Stolen Motor Vehicles Items and once completed, send it along form IRP-6.

agent: You must send it to International Registration Bureau, PO Box 2850, Albany, NY, 12220-0850. user: How to get a refund from the New York state portion of the IRP registration fees I paid to other jurisdictions? agent: You may request that refound only if the other jurisdiction made an error and the error is on your invoice and/or you paid duplicate apportioned registration fees for the same vehicle. user: One of my apportioned plates was stolen, what should I do? agent: Fill the form "Report of Lost or Stolen Motor Vehicle Items MV-78B from a police agency and send form MV-78B with form IRP-6 Surrender the apportioned plates only if no vehicle will replace the current vehicle.

agent: He'll have to change his address.  user: What would he need to do update his address?Does he have to communicate with DMV or send them some items to their office?  agent: He'll have to go to a DMV office and provide  a completed Application for Duplicate Title PDF MV-902s a proof of identity and $ 20.00 for the replacement fee.  user: Ok, one more question. Regarding my replacement title, I reckon I have some time today to go to a DMV office, I think it'll be faster than doing it by mail. Would I be issued my replacement immediately? agent: No, you won't be issued the replacement title while you are there. All title certificates are printed in a secure facility in Albany and are mailed to the owners. For this reason I suggest you stick to doing the whole process by mail, since it's faster and you can do it from the comfort of your home.

agent: Use the Application for Title Only MV-82TON and follow the instructions carefully. user: What should I do if I am about to move? agent: You need to learn how to change your address. user: What items should I send to the DMV office? agent: Send a completed form "Application for Duplicate Title MV-902".

user: I'll get into it, thanks. Now, when i apply for a replacement title, it'll be issued in the DMV office? user: The same day i apply for it, i mean? agent: Sorry, but that would be a no. For practical reasons, all certificates are printed in a secure facility foreign to the DMV and then mailed to you. That way is more fast and easy. user: Um, sounds logical. In any case, what items i need to bring to DMV when i look for the replacement process? agent: You have to bring with you a completed Application for Duplicate Title or MV-902.

user: No, I don't want to receive it by way of standard mail, I would fear that it may get lost in the mail agent: Would you then prefer to receive the title certificate by express mail? user: I would prefer not to, as I am afraid that it may get lost in the mail user: If I apply for a replacement title certificate at the DMV office, can they issue the certificate to me there and then? agent: You cannot get the replacement title certificate issued to you in the DMV office, all replacement certificates are printed in a secure facility and are mailed to the owners. agent: You won't receive your replacement title certificate at the DMV office, they are printed at an off-site facility and are mailed to the owner user: Where is the replacement certificate sent if the registration for the vehicle is in my name? agent: The re[placement is mailed to the address that is held on file for you. user: No, I'm not in a hurry. user: How will I receive the title? agent: You will apply at the DMV, and it will be mailed to you. user: Can I apply for just the title? agent: Yes, just select title only and follow the instructions.

agent: There is no guarantee the DMV will forward them. Please contact them with updated info. user: Where are certificates printed? agent: In a secure facility in Albany. user: Can I change the address online? agent: No, you have to contact the Title Service Bureau.

agent: Do you want to qualify as a certified escort driver? user: Yes please agent: In order to qualify as an escort driver, you must be 21 years or over, have a valid state drivers license and you must pass the Escort Driver's Certification Test user: Can I complete the Escort driver Certification test at any office if they provide this service? agent: Every office that provides the certification test will have it indicated in the "Office Hours" area for that particular office

agent: No. It will not be valid when that happens. user: If i am 21 years old this year but my birthday is yet to come, can i qualify as a certified escort driver? agent: No. You need to be 21 years old and fulfill the other 2 requirements to qualify. user: Okay. agent: No, you can't. agent: great, what is your question? user: does NY state recognize escort vehicle driver certifications issued in other states? agent: you must have a valid ny state certified vehicle escort card mv-64 user: do i do it at the dmv? agent: it will be indicated in office hours area for the office

agent: That's good news. agent: You must bring the plates and your copy of the MV-78B to the DMV office to surrender them. You must then apply for new plates to get your registration re-instated user: What if my plates are missing? agent: With missing plates, you must bring your copy of the MV-78B form to the DMV office and then apply for new plates and a re-instatement of your registrtion user: What is the situation if my vehicle and plates have been recovered before I file the MV-78B form and the stolen vehicle alarm has already been cancelled? agent: In this instance, your registration is still active and so, you are able to keep using your registration

agent: No. The first thing you need to do is inform the police so that the stolen vehicle alarm would be cancelled. agent: In case the vehicle is recovered, the first thing you should do is to make sure the police cancel the alarm of stolen vehicle so the recovery can be listed on your title record. agent: Yes, bring a copy of MV-78B to apply for new plates. user: Can I go ahead and get new plates before the insurance company finishes investigating? agent: No, resolve the issue with the insurance company first, the apply for new plates. user: What do I do if my car is stolen? agent: Report it to both the police and your insurance company immediately.

agent: Yes, you have 60 days from the date of the ALJs decision to file the Appeal From DMV Hearing Determination AA-33A, which must be accompanied by the appropriate filing fee. user: What happens if I am revoked? agent: If you are revoked, you must surrender all supplies and cease to operate. user: And what if the ALJ only imposes civil penalties? agent: To prevent the loss of your operating privilege, you must pay all fines and penalties and you will receive a letter from DMV after the hearing.

agent: If you take that action, then inevitably a hearing will take place. user: So, the best action course would be to accept those charges, isn't? That would help me? agent: Yes, it would. In that way, no hearing would be held or even required. user: I guess that would do for the better. What will happen after i receive my penalty? agent: If you complain with your penalty, or pay your fine, then you'll have nothing to worry about because you'll be back on operations in no time.

user: I'm not relying on any ALJ decision as I'm not going through any hearing at the moment user: If, after a hearing, I pay my fine and/or penalty or serve out my period of suspension, how soon will I be able to resume normal practice? agent: After complete compliance of the outcome of any hearing, you will be able to resume normal prectice user: What happens if I appeal a decision that is made at a hearing? agent: You will have 60 days from the date of the decision made by the ALJ in which to file an Appeal From DMV Hearing Determination PDF (2) AA-33A. The appropriate fee must be submitted along with this documentation

agent: In order to appeal the decision made at a hearing, you have 60 days from the date of decision to file an Appeal From DMV Hearing Determination, and this must be filed along with the appropriate fee user: What if the ALJ at the hearing imposes civil penalties? agent: If this is the case, you will receive a letter shortly after the hearing. To prevent the loss of your operating privileges, you will be required to pay all fines and penalties imposed user: What happens if I decide to pay my fine and any penalties imposed or serve out any period of suspension? agent: After complete compliance with the findings of the hearing, you will be entitled to resume your business

agent: When initiate by Vehicle Safety, you can be offered a "hearing waiver" during which you will be given an opportunity to admit the charges and to either pay a monetary penalty and/or accept a suspension user: What if the ALJ only imposes civil penalties during a hearing process? agent: In this instance, you will receive a letter shortly after the hearing which will outline that in order to prevent the loss of your operating privilege, you must pay all fines and penalties that have been imposed user: If I comply fully and pay my fine or serve out the period of suspension handed down, what happens then? agent: If you fulfil this and have been completely compliant, you will be back in business

agent: Yes and the fines or penalties might be reduced or you may be offered to compensate the customer instead of paying the fines or penalties. user: What happen if I am revoked? agent: If you are revoked, you will need to cease to operate and surrender all supplies. user: Can I appeal? agent: Yes you may and you need to file the Appeal From DMV Hearing Determination PDF [ 2 ] AA-33A, 60 days from the date of the decision of the ALJ.

agent: if you pay the fine you will be allowed to return to work and business will be running after compliance. user: What happens if there is no action at the hearing? agent:  you may be offered the opportunity to pay restitution to the consumer or have the penalty reduced depending on the result of the hearing user: what happens if there is action at the hearing? agent: it depends on the situation, but the ALJ may sustain all, some, or none of the charges

agent: You must pay all fines to avoid possible loss of operating privilage user: Is there a way to appeal the decision? agent: to appeal the decision you have 60 days from the date of the ALJs decision to file the Appeal From DMV Hearing Determination PDF [ 2 ] AA-33A , which must be accompanied by the appropriate filing fee . user: Will I lose my business license? agent:  That is a good question. Complaints filed and charges brought against you can result in the loss of your privilege to operate as a business here

agent: you have 60 days from the date of the ALJs decision to file the Appeal From DMV Hearing Determination PDF [ 2 ] AA-33A , which must be accompanied by the appropriate filing fee  user: can I request a hearing? agent: you may be offered the opportunity through a " hearing waiver " to admit to the charges and to either pay a specified monetary penalty and/or to accept a suspension
 user: How will i know i get a hearing? agent: you may be offered the opportunity through a " hearing waiver " to admit to the charges and to either pay a specified monetary penalty and/or to accept a suspension

agent: CLP or Commercial Learner Permit are permits, whereas CDL(Commercial Driver License) is the actual license. user: Can a CLP be suspended or revoked like a CDL? agent: Yes. agent: There are several incidents which would result in a restriction on your license. agent: Section 140 of the New York State Transportation Law is amended to provide that no employer will allow an employee to operate a commercial motor vehicle during any period in which the operator does not have a valid CLP or CDL or does not have those with a proper class or endorsement user: What if I have a CDL with an L restriction? agent: You will be upgraded from an L to a Z restriction user: What happens if my medical certification becomes not certified? agent: The New York State DMV will send CLP holders a notification if their medical certification status becomes " Not Certified.

agent: An E restriction is given when you are driving an automatic and this is yoru first road test in a CMV user: What happens if I have an open suspension? agent: The CDL Permit Rule broadens the criteria used during CLP and CDL license applications to check for open suspensions and revocations in other states .New York State will reject any application where a driver has any open suspension or revocation in any state user: What if I have a CDL with an L restriction? agent: You will be upgraded from an L to a Z restriction

agent: You will be required to pay a driver responsibility assessment each year for the next three years user: What happens if I am convicted of driving under suspension or revocation? agent: You may be fined and you may be sentenced to jail and/or probation.
